Continue to Create Boarding Pass/Security Document? (You can print from the next screen or at the airport)

Why do you need this information?
Close
The TSA has determined that mandating the provision of date of birth and gender would greatly reduce the number of passengers misidentified as a match to the watch list. It is to the passenger's advantage to provide the required data elements as doing so may prevent delays or additional passenger security screening at the airport, particularly for those individuals who have similar names to those on the watch list.
Close
What should I bring to the Security Checkpoint?
To get through the Security Checkpoint, you'll need:
  • A government-issued photo ID
  • Either a Boarding Pass or Security Document
Customers under 18 years of age are not required to show govenment-issued photo ID.
What is a Security Document?
  • Customers not checking luggage may print out a Security Document as early as 24 hours prior to schedule departure time (local departure time). If all flight segments fall within this timeframe, a Security Document will print for each flight segment. If a flight segment does not fall within this timeframe, you will need to print your Security Document beginning at 24 hours prior to departure for that flight segment.
  • Customers receiving a Security Document rather than a Boarding Pass at the airport include:
    • Standby Customers
    • Nonrevenue, Space Available Customers
    • Customers who arrive 20 minutes or less prior to scheduled departure
    • Customers traveling on a flight that has been gate restricted
  • Customers will be required to surrender the Security Document to the Customer Service Agent at the Departure Gate to receive a Boarding Pass. Customers are advised to keep the Security Document with them until they check in and get a Boarding Pass.
